Package controller

Class PreGameController

java.lang.Object
controller.PreGameController
public class PreGameController extends Object
The PreGameController class contains the logic for pre-game screen operations
Version:
June 16, 2024
Author:
Andrew Polyak

  • Constructor Summary

    Constructors
    Constructor
    Description
    PreGameController(javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane appLaunchView, javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane preGameView, javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane pongGameView, javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane loginView, javafx.scene.layout.AnchorPane createAcctView, javafx.scene.control.Button menuBtn, javafx.scene.control.Button startBtn, javafx.scene.text.Text welcomeMsg, javafx.scene.text.Text numWinsMsg, User user, DataController data, ArrayList<User> users)
    The PreGameController constructor initiates all pane objects for the pre-game page, as well as instances of ArrayList of User, and DataController to manage saving of said ArrayList

  • Method Summary

    Modifier and Type
    Method
    Description
    private void
    backToStartScreenBtnHandler()
    The backToStartscreenBtnHandler method alters AnchorPane visibility so as to return the user to the app's launch screen
    void
    getPreGameScreenInput()
    The getLoginScreenInput method contains the handling methods for the back button and login button
    private void
    setMessages()
    The setMessages method sets a user-specific welcome back message and win count message
    void
    setOnGameStart(Runnable onGameStart)
    The setOnGameStart method instantiates onGameStart
    private void
    startPongGameBtnHandler()
    The startPongGameBtnHandler method listens for the "Start Game" button press
    Once clicked, the pong game screen is opened and the game logic "container" runs
    void
    updateWinCount()
    The updateWinCount method increments the user's win count by 1
